title: Static 15-entry Problem→Solution Blog page + SVG favicon integration

requirements.summary: Replace /blog dynamic previews + auto-initialization with exactly 15 static Problem→Solution finance entries rendered on-page for public users.
acceptanceCriteria: Visiting /blog renders a list/grid of exactly 15 entries.
Each entry includes a clearly labeled “Problem:” line and a clearly labeled “Solution:” line, matching the user-provided text.
The page does not call blog preview queries/mutations (no loading state for fetching, and no automatic initialization when empty).
The Blog page works for unauthenticated users (consistent with current public navigation).

file_operations.description: Add a static exported array of exactly 15 finance blog entries (each with a title plus clearly labeled Problem and Solution strings) using the exact user-provided text; no backend IDs/slugs required.

Update the existing /blog page implementation to render the 15 static Problem→Solution entries from frontend/src/content/staticProblemSolutionBlogs.ts; remove all usage of blog preview fetching hooks and default-content initialization (including useGetAllBlogPreviews, useInitializeDefaultContent, loading/initialization states, and related effects) so the page is fully static and publicly accessible.

requirements.summary: Add the provided SVG as /favicon.svg and wire it in index.html so browsers use it as the site favicon.
acceptanceCriteria: A new static file is present at frontend/public/favicon.svg containing the exact SVG content provided by the user.
frontend/index.html includes a <link rel="icon" type="image/svg+xml" href="/favicon.svg"> entry.
After build, the site shows the new favicon in the browser tab (where supported).

file_operations.description: Create the favicon asset at this exact path and paste in the exact SVG content provided by the user (unchanged).
Add a head link tag referencing the new SVG favicon: <link rel="icon" type="image/svg+xml" href="/favicon.svg"> (keep existing PNG favicon links as fallback unless they conflict).
